intro: Randia micrantha, commonly known as small-flowered randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers with four to five petals.
